alert.note: Alert for Sacramento (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 31 at 9:13PM PST until January 01 at 9:15PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... A Levee Failure on the Cosumnes River along Levees near Wilton rd. and bridge in... East Central Sacramento County in central California... * Until 915 PM PST Sunday. * At 913 PM PST, county dispatch reported the Levees near Wilton rd. and bridge on the Cosumnes River Near Wilton are in a state of imminent failure causing flash flooding of immediately surrounding areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from a levee failure. SOURCE...County Officials. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas near the levee break. * Wilton, Wilton Road This includes the following streams and drainages... Cosumnes River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE LEVEE FAILURE...OCCURRING
info.instruction: If you are in low lying areas along the Levees near Wilton rd. and bridge you should move to higher ground immediately. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
